Articles.Content: Is there a Kerbal dev tracker somewhere. I'd just like something I can easily keep track of official posts from the devs as they come out.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/70-The-Daily-Kerbal](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/70-The-Daily-Kerbal)

That, mostly.

If, for whatever reason, you're adverse to using the forums for this:

[http://kerbaldevteam.tumblr.com/](https://kerbaldevteam.tumblr.com/)

But that should be exactly the same information as on the forums.

There is the [dev blog](https://kerbaldevteam.tumblr.com/).

Important announcements and the weekly Devnote Tuesdays (updates on game development) are posted there, along with a number of community related things (Modding Mondays, Video Wednesdays, Twitch Thursdays, Fanwork Fridays)

EDIT: Ninja'd. And yes, the Daily Kerbal has all the same stuff.

The most important long-form info comes to the forums. 

But if you are prepared to wade through not-KSP personal postings,

 some tidbits may leak out through KSP producer [Maxmaps twitter](https://twitter.com/Maxmaps/) account, [and Reddit](http://www.reddit.com/user/Maxmaps).

Maxmaps' Twitter account and Reddit generally get information first, then some random forum user posts it here, then Squad updates the forums here. Also the Twitch stream has pretty good information but you have to wait for a transcription from a dedicted forum-goer (ObsessedWithKSP) to post it if you can't stand watching Max play the game.

Basically go somewhere else if you want fresh information.
